clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: The best advice was literally to get in and do and the rest will figure itself out.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Connie speaks with straightforward, no-BS clarity — she's practical, direct, and cuts through overthinking with simple truths.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It challenges the paralysis-by-analysis trap new agents fall into by offering permission to act before feeling ready.

HOOK.text: New agents spend six months preparing. Top producers spend six days doing.
HOOK.production_note: Split screen: overwhelmed agent at desk with courses/books vs agent knocking on door

SETUP.text: You're waiting to feel ready. Waiting for the perfect script, the perfect market, the perfect confidence. Meanwhile, someone who started last week just closed their first deal.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll: unopened real estate course materials, dusty business cards, calendar days flipping by

INSIGHT.text: Connie Mahan — REALTOR of the Year in Central Florida — got the advice that changed everything: 'Get in and do. The rest will figure itself out.' Not 'study more.' Not 'wait until you're comfortable.' Do. She didn't know every answer. She learned by showing up. Door-knocking taught her objection handling better than any course. Open houses taught her buyer psychology. Expired listings taught her confidence. The doing created the knowing.
INSIGHT.production_note: Quick cuts of agent activities: door-knocking, open house sign, phone calls, showing homes — all with energetic pacing

REFRAME.text: Here's what nobody tells you: your first ten conversations will be terrible. And that's the point. You can't learn swimming from a book. You're not unprepared — you're untested. There's a difference.
REFRAME.production_note: Close-up of agent's face showing nerves turning to determination

CTA.text: So here's your assignment: before you watch another training video, do one thing that scares you. Door-knock five homes. Call three expireds. Host an open house. Then tell me what you learned that no course could've taught you.
CTA.production_note: Direct to camera, confident energy. End on freeze frame of agent taking first step out the door

caption: Stop studying. Start doing. The best training is the one that terrifies you.
